feed.title: Hardcoded seeds, DNS seeds and Darknet nodes

entry.title: Hardcoded seeds, DNS seeds and Darknet nodes
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around the necessity of implementing an encoding mechanism that can accurately reconstruct the order of entries in a response. This is essential because recursive resolvers have the capability to alter the sequence of entries within a response. The fundamental premise is based on ensuring data integrity and reliability in processes where the original order of entries is critical for accurate interpretation or further processing. The solution proposed addresses the challenge posed by the natural behavior of recursive resolvers, which might otherwise disrupt the intended order of data, leading to potential inaccuracies or misinterpretations of the information being conveyed.
